Jorjani cautioned listeners, however, that these injections of third-party DNA need to look and feel appropriate to the setting. After all, if you start fecklessly chucking the Zerg, Chaos Space Marines or Fifth Element's, er, flying taxis into Helldivers 2, it might spoil the meticulous coherency of a game in which saluting protects you against lethal falls and some guy called Joel is running the universe. The funny part is that according to Jorjani, Arrowhead once envisaged a system that would get round the problem of inconsistency by essentially making third-party cosmetics, including whole map skins, visible only to players who have them enabled. To put that another way, Arrowhead once envisaged a system in which individual Helldivers would hallucinate other licenses.
  
Read more
articles.title: Helldivers 2 devs once considered a licensed cosmetic system that basically let you hallucinate a different world

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The mutant enemies in Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl are very hungry. Hungry not only for your flesh, but also all the bullets in your AK-47. It can take entire clips of ammo to take down some of these tough beasts, and you get nothing back for killing this wildlife except the hollow satisfaction of pest control. Alongside the bugs and performance issues, it's a common enough complaint to players of the first-person survival shooter that it's already been addressed by a modder, who has created a tweak to lower the health of various dogs, boars, and bloodsuckers. 
Read more
articles.title: Stalker 2's bulletsponge mutants can be nerfed with this handy mod, saving you precious rounds

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Long before Hideo Kojima made the first triple-A walking simulator, he was trying to spin sunlight into bullets. The game in question, Boktai: The Sun Is In Your Hand, is a Game Boy Advance title from 2003, in which you play a vampire-slaying gunslinger. The gun you're slinging is a "solar-powered" pistol, which you could charge up using a cartridge-mounted photometric sensor by physically standing in sunshine. This was 13 years before the launch of Pokemon Go. Sadly, Boktai's debut didn't result in city parks or rooftops being flooded by crowds of GBA-wielding undead killers. But it was a fun gimmick and the game itself is good enough to carry it - an isometric dungeon-crawler in which you have to find a vamp's coffin and drag it to the surface for purgation.
 Read more
articles.title: Kura5 is a free spiritual successor to Kojima's sun-loving Boktai vampire-hunting series

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Upon some serious soul searching following a little time with the early access build of open world game Vivat Slovakia, I have unfortunately had to admit to myself that it is probably not the GTA 6 killer I was hoping for. This upsets me slightly, because I find Rockstar’s constant self-assured bloviating to be quite irritating, even though I’m sure I’ll play their game for a billion hours. What Vivat Slovakia is, then, is a very ambitious homage to the Grand Theft Auto series that isn’t shy about it, right down to the font choices. I’m not sure if you should play it, but I do feel enriched for learning of its existence. Here’s a trailer.
Read more
articles.title: I no longer care about Grand Theft Auto 6, for I have the open world of Vivat Slovakia

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Kill The Man In The House is a video game title I can get behind. It tells me exactly what I need to do before I even boot up the game, which is otherwise powerfully weird-looking. The cover art is reminiscent of a children's book, if it were for adults. Or a lost episode of Ed Edd and Eddy, where a fourth older sibling (Eddie) acts on his murderous intent and engages in some slick FPSing. Either way, there's a demo out on Steam and despite being very short and limited, I am excited for its future.
Read more
articles.title: You'll never guess what you do in Kill The Man In The House

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The Hobbit movies are a mixed Baggins indeed - at once thunderous and thin, like butter scraped over too much bread - but one sequence I love from The Desolation of Smaug is Bilbo searching Erebor for the Arkenstone, while trying not to rouse the titular dragon from his slumber. Don't Wake The Beast is sort of that sequence plus Spelunkified procgen levels and Thief-esque stealth mechanics.
Read more
articles.title: Don't Wake The Beast is a blend of Thief and Spelunky where you must let sleeping dragons lie

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
If the surprising number of you brought scurrying out of the woodwork by the announcement of Redwall-style survival game Hawthorn is anything to go by, the medieval rodent fanatic to RPS reader pipeline is a sturdy one, despite being constantly nibbled at. Here’s some more delicious bait for you, then. Mossflower TW is a campaign mod for Medieval II: Total War expansion Kingdoms that lets ranks of mace-wielding mice, helmeted hedgehogs, and ornery otters skitter wildly all over the venerable strategy game. It’s been about since Summer, and the team have been working on patching since. It seems very playable, if the footage of people playing it is anything to go by. Here’s a video by YouTuber Tharshey so you can see it in action:
Read more
articles.title: Turn Medieval II: Total War into Redwall with this Mossflower TW mod

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Various games in the Shiren The Wanderer (and Mystery Dungeon) series have been recommended to me over and over, but I've yet to play any of them. I likely won't play the next, either. Shiren The Wanderer: The Mystery Dungeon Of Serpentcoil Island is headed to PC via Steam soon.

 
Read more
articles.title: The first new Shiren The Wanderer game in 14 years is headed to PC

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Assassin's Creed Shadows is making changes to how it handles stealth, versus other games in the long-running series. Gone is the companion eagle who can spot enemies for you, for a start; instead, players can hide in the - hey - shadows, lie on their tummies for the first time, and make use of a "shinobi and assassin arsenal" of smoke bombs and bells.

There are old moves that are coming back after an absence, too: Shadows will allow for 'double assassinations' again.

 
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows outlines its stealth systems - which luckily includes the ability to hide in shadows

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Star Wars Outlaws' stealth has been much debated, though not hotly. Some people think it's rubbish, some others think it's basically fine. Ubisoft themselves seem to think it's one of the key issues with the game, with the creative director previously saying the forced stealth sections are "incredibly punishing".

Now there's a new patch, apparently Outlaws' biggest yet, and stealth and combat are firmly in the crosshairs. The AI and player detection has changed; you can now choose combat in areas where it was previously not allowed; and enemies have had weak points added, for those who wish to cause massive damage.

 
Read more
articles.title: Star Wars Outlaws' latest patch is out and aims to make stealth and combat more satisfying

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I go through this life burdened by the knowledge that I will never be framed for murder on a luxurious, multiple-day train journey. Not for me the thrill of flushing out the true culprit (or culprits???) between visits to the exquisitely upholstered dining car, against the backdrop of passing mountains. The best I can hope for is getting chewed out for hogging the toilet on a crowded commuter train to Leeds.
 Read more
articles.title: The jazz is as smooth as the spritework in murder mystery Loco Motive, out now

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl stays largely faithful to the original series’ bleak yet inquisitive tone and propensity for technical problems, but there’s another, much smaller feature that it also brings back: silly titles for its lesser NPCs. All the major and side characters are, indeed, characters, but rather than leave inconsequential henchmen and roving bandits nameless, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 assigns Zone-merc handles to each and every one of them. Some try to sound badass, some might as well have been chosen by the owner panickedly looking around the room for something to name himself after, and all of them sound like they should be on the actor's wall in Toast of London.
Because your life partly depends on relieving slain foes of their belongings, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 encourages you to get up close and looty with these blokes, meaning you end up spending a lot of time reading goofy nicknames. I thought I’d pay tribute to the best ones I’ve seen so far, even if the majority of these honours will need to be given posthumously.
Read more
articles.title: If one thing works in S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2, it’s the incomprehensible name generator for random NPCs

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Overthrown is a city building game made by and for people who can't work out whether they love or despise city building games. In this curious concoction from developers Brimstone and publishers Maximum Entertainment, you are a chirpy anime monarch equipped with a magic crown that confers the ability to seize entire buildings and throw them away because aaaararargahragrhagh, I am sick of this dang sawmill. I am sick of perfecting the infrastructure. I am sick of stockpiling food for the winter. I am sick of my hard-working peasants and their happiness levels. I am going to pick everything up and hurl it into the sky. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Overthrown is a city builder where you can throw your whole city at the sky because secretly, you hate city builders

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
I’ll stand by my review when I say that S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl is worth playing, in spite of it the many and varied ways in which it’s utterly broken. To be clear, though, it is utterly broken, in many and varied ways.
That makes my usual new-game performance analysis/settings guide song and dance harder to pull off, with or without the appropriate soundtrack. Is S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 in such dire technical straits that we should wait for a few patches before giving it a shake? And how can its best settings be anointed if some, particularly FSR 3 frame generation, simply don’t work as they should?
Read more
articles.title: Here's a S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 performance and settings guide I hope gets out of date really fast

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I have significant reservations about Avowed, Obsidian's first-person Pillars Of Eternity spin-off RPG, but those reservations are significantly offset by the fact that I can be an undersea mushroom woman called Mystic Meg. In Avowed, you are the god-touched envoy of a distant emperor, sent to an island realm known as the Living Lands to investigate a mysterious blight. "God-touched", in this case, means "fungal and a bit mermaidy". It means that you can make rainbow toadstools sprout from your eyesocket in the character creator. It means that you can accessorise your cheekbones with what look like bracket polypores, or deck your ears with staghorn coral. 
 
Read more
articles.title: Avowed's rickety combat feels like the undoing of its lush fungal world

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Valve have unveiled a new policy about season passes on Steam, which aims to ensure that developers release all the individual DLC involved on time and share adequate details about each DLC pack in advance. It specifies that developers can delay release of a season pass DLC just once, and by no longer than three months. In the event that a developer postpones DLC release by longer than three months, Valve may take such corrective actions as removing the season pass from sale or refunding players.
 Read more
articles.title: Steam tighten up rules for games with season pass DLC: "you have to commit to completing that content on time"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Two theme parks are being planned based on Minecraft. Mojang are partnering with Merlin Entertainments to open the destinations, including rides, hotel rooms and shops, in the UK and US in 2026 and 2027. Merlin are the operator of existing theme parks and attractions including Alton Towers, Legoland, Sea Life, and Madame Tussauds.

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft is getting two theme parks, with the first due in 2026

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Valve said that they want to make a new Steam Controller back in 2022, but such a thing might be getting closer to production, according to dataminer Brad Lynch.

 
Read more
articles.title: Valve might be moving closer to a Steam Controller 2 and new VR controllers, rumours say

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 is making changes to how it handles mods in order to address server stability issues. Come the next big update in December, mods "will be prohibited from public online sessions," according to an update from the game director.

 
Read more
articles.title: Space Marine 2 will ban mods from public games to address server stability and save corruption issues

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I've been looking forward to Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 since it was announced, but I might wait a while longer before trying to play it. It launched yesterday and currently sits at "overwhelmingly negative" Steam reviews due to long loading times caused by server issues.

 
Read more
articles.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024's launch has been marred by long load times, server issues and now it has overwhelmingly negative reviews

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Gang Beasts is one of the games I think of when I recall the golden days of video game expos, before Covid rolled up and nuked the business model. It casts you as one of several jellybaby pugilists, fighting for dominance over such locations as Ferris wheels and the tops of speeding vans. All of the characters are 1) seemingly drunk, and 2) subject to real-time physics. Your abilities consist of 1) punching, headbutting or kicking people, perhaps knocking them out for a few seconds, and 2) grabbing people and things and either hoisting them skyward like a wrestler, or hoisting yourself skyward like a toddler climbing onto Mummy's head. The only way of defeating people is to hurl them off-map.
 Read more
articles.title: Masterfully silly brawler Gang Beasts gets surprise update with driveable cranes and Hitchcockian bird attacks

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
One of my proudest pictures of a 2018 trip to Croatia wasn't of me and my pal. No, it wasn't of the beautiful scenery or the glistening sea either. It was of many cats lying in the sun together outside a little church. I hadn't seen that volume of cats in my life, nor that volume together in one spot, all hanging out. Now, you too can live this magic: there's a demo of this upcoming sidescroller called Neko Odyssey on Steam, and it consists of you taking photos of cats for internet clout. It's nice!
Read more
articles.title: This sidescroller combines cat photography with the joy (misery) of social media clout-farming

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart Of Chornobyl is out today. As you may have read, it's on the buggy side. Buggier than a bucketful of locusts. Buggier than Kafka's Metamorphosis. In our S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart Of Chornobyl review, wasteland wanderer James called it "easily the most borked FPS I've played in years", detailing such issues as HUD elements disappearing, stuttery performance, flashing textures and character mouths not working properly. 
 
Read more
articles.title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 is out now and buggy as hell but the developers are already planning fixes

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Did last week's paranormal body-swapper Slitterhead leave you cold? Do you consider its brain-jacking of rando cityfolk for monster-hunting purposes a sad waste of potential? Perhaps you'll prefer RAM: Random Access Mayhem, out now in Steam early access, in which you're a fugitive AI hopping between warlike robot bodies in top-down view.
Yes, the subtitle involves both a colon and a dad joke, but the demo is entertaining - Nuclear Throne meets Ctrl Alt Ego, in short. The one major criticism I have after 20 minutes or so is that the flat pixelart perspective makes walls and walkable surfaces look interchangeable, and this feels more like a question of acclimatisation than a real complaint.
 Read more
articles.title: Come steal the bodies of your robot foes in RAM: Random Access Mayhem, out now in early access

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
We’re probably all past "And in the game" jokes by now, but it is fitting that S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart Of Chornobyl is about venturing into a shattered world and enduring the worst of its logic-defying hardships to find the treasures within. This is a bold, uncompromising survival FPS that can easily capture you for days on end – but I can’t invite you back into the Zone without hammering in a few hundred warning signs reading "DANGER: BUGS". In Ukrainian, obviously.
Read more
articles.title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart Of Chornobyl review: a captivating survival shooter, even with bits falling off

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
On 11th October 2024, three video game studios announced themselves near-simultaneously as the creators of “spiritual successors” to ZA/UM’s mournful Marxist RPG Disco Elysium. First came Longdue, a conspicuously corporate operator who are making an untitled “psychogeographic RPG”. Dark Math Games followed around lunchtime - they’re making a sexy Antarctic ski resort mystery called XXX Nightshift. Finally, there was Summer Eternal, the mouthiest and Marxiest of the lot, who have set themselves up as a workers co-operative and have yet to announce a specific project.
Read more
articles.title: There's a playable Disco Elysium 2 prototype in the wilds, according to a report on clashes between the "spiritual successors"

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
In 2015 a flight by Germanwings carrying 144 passengers and six crew crashed into a mountain in the French Alps. Later, the authorities who investigated the crash judged it was intentional - somebody in the cockpit had purposefully crashed the plane in an act of suicide, killing themselves and everyone on board. Mouthwashing begins with the same premise, albeit in a sci-fi setting. You're piloting a spaceship with a crew of five, clicking on its various controls to override the safety and turn the ship towards a nearby heap of space rock. You mean to crash. The words that appear moments before this sequence are chilling in their simplicity: "I hope this hurts."
Read more
articles.title: Mouthwashing is the most horrifying game of 2024

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Workers at Reflector Entertainment, the Montreal studio that recently released third-person action adventure Unknown 9: Awakening, have been hit by layoffs, according to a number of employees who made the cuts public on social media. The studio is owned by Bandai Namco and released the game about a month ago. The exact number of people out of work isn't known, as Reflector haven't made a public statement about it. (Update: A statement from Reflector says the layoffs amount to 18% of the total workforce). Among those affected are folks working in art, design, UI, lighting, and narrative. 
Read more
articles.title: Layoffs hit workers at Reflector Entertainment, makers of Unknown 9: Awakening

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Remedy's Control 2 will be an "action RPG", the developers have announced, and while I have already caved and written it up, I'm not sure this is really news. Wasn't the first game an action-RPG? True, it was a third-person shooter, but it also had a progression system with unlockable abilities and boosts. Besides, isn't every action game an action-RPG these days? Levelling-up has become an industry-wide syndrome. Go on, name an action game that doesn't have RPG-style elements. No wait, don't actually do that. I was being rhetorical. Read the rest of this post first.
 
Read more
articles.title: Control 2 will be an action-RPG, and the first game is getting a significant update in 2025

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
My time with Threshold has been fraught with pain. Five times. Five times I had to restart this psychological horror game because of some game-breaking bug. And yet, I persevered, booting it back up and returning to my government-mandated shift atop a quiet mountain.
Ultimately, I gave Threshold chance after chance because I was totally taken by my shift and my immense desire to find out just what I was actually doing. Anyway, it's time for me to clock off! I urge you to take over until I'm back. It's worth it.
Read more
articles.title: Threshold review: put in the shift and you shall be... rewarded

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Mildly dissatisfactory space strategy game Homeworld 3 will receive its last major update this week, developers Blackbird Interactive have announced. Due to launch on 21st November, Update 1.3 will deliver "a gargantuan number of improvements, fixes, and some entirely new features". These broadly consist of combat and balance overhauls together with changes for the Skirmish & War Games modes, though they've shown the campaign a little love as well.

 
Read more
articles.title: Homeworld 3's last major update adds superweapons, campaign interludes and a new armour system

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 launches on Steam and the Microsoft Store today. Developed once again by Asobo - otherwise celebrated for their stinking rat hordes - it builds upon the 2020 game by "[taking] advantage of the latest technologies in simulation, cloud, machine learning, graphics and gaming", in the words of the launch announcement release.
We've got a review in the works, but code has landed late, so our write-up might take a while. In the shorter term, I thought you might like to know how, exactly, MFS 2024 makes use of "machine learning" technologies, taking into account the energy cost of such wacky gadgetry and the creeping relationship between increased reliance on automated tools and laying people off. More immediately, you might like to know how much of your internet package it'll devour as you play.
 
Read more
articles.title: How Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 uses machine learning AI, and how much of your data it might need

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
A long while ago I wrote about Vampire Survivors-likes needing to stop overwhelming you with visual clutter. I've since played a few games of a similar ilk that don't hammer you with a chaos that's impossible to dissect with your eyeballs. One of these is Bloodshed, an old school FPS take on the VS formula that actually works pretty well and did have me thinking the treacherous phrase "just one more run".
Read more
articles.title: Bloodshed is Vampire Survivors meets Doom and it's a surprisingly moreish bloodbath

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
I am a very casual enjoyer of Metal Slug games. I've never actually paid for one of these side-scrolling shoot 'em ups, except for all the countless coins I happily pumped into arcade machines as a child. To this day, if I see a rare glittering cabinet running one of these crunchy shmups, I will go ham for twenty or thirty minutes, and walk away satisfied that I have seen a lot of very good pixels. These games, I am convinced, were never really designed to be completed, but to be played exactly like this, as a coin-gobbling invitation to become a bandana-wearing sisyphus, a tiny Rambo pushing a bouncy, juddering tank up a hill occupied by cartoon nazis. You die a bunch and say: "ah, that was good."
So what happens when you rearrange the molecules of this run and/or gun 'em up into an isometric turn-based strategy game? You get Metal Slug Tactics, an off-kilter nod to Into The Breach and other grid-based turn-takers, but secretly housing the aggressive notions of an unhinged pyromaniac. You still die a lot. And you still walk away feeling fairly happy about it.
Read more
articles.title: Metal Slug Tactics review: the crunchy arcade run 'n' gun pauses to have a tactical think

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Good morning, how about a nice big bowl of your favourite breakfast cereal: Corporate Consolidation? Sony are in talks to buy Kadokawa, the parent company of Elden Ring developer From Software. Sony is eyeing up the company as a hefty snack because they want the various manga and anime owned by Kadokawa, according to a report by Reuters. But also because they want all the tasty games owned by them too, such as the Danganronpa series, the Octopath Traveler games, and the biggest corn flake of them all, the Dark Souls series.
Read more
articles.title: Sony is in talks to buy Dark Souls and Elden Ring parent company Kadokawa

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
It takes a special kind of entitled bellyacher to complain that you wanted a different game from a game that hasn't even been announced yet, and which may simply be an internet rumour. It's like the "glass half empty" mindset, but the bartender hasn't even taken your order and this might not even be a bar. Odds are you've wandered into the local antique shop. Well I, friends, am that bellyacher. Here I stand at the "bar", gesticulating wildly over my non-existent glass.
In this scenario, the confused bartender/antique shop owner is Turtle Rock, developers of Left 4 Dead homage Back 4 Blood. Rumour has it that they're making a Back 4 Blood 2 - but as I loudly explain to the bartender/antique shop owner, showering the cocktail measures/vintage Toby Jugs in spittle, I don't want a Back 4 Blood 2. I want a follow-up to 2015's Evolve, in which four hunters team up to track down a fifth person playing as a kaiju. "A flagon of your finest Gorgon, please," I roar, thumping the bar, while Turtle Rock tries to sell me a gentleman's travelling suitcase from the 1920s.
Read more
articles.title: Back 4 Blood 2 appears to be a thing, which is a shame, because I'd rather play a new Evolve

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I'm still bumbling, tumbling and blundering through the cavernous labyrinths of first-person spelunking sim Lorn's Lure, in which you are an android exploring a series of enormous machines and sunken artificial habitats. I hope one day to level up from "bumbling, tumbling and blundering" to "running and jumping". Perhaps I'll even get as far as "speedrunning". But in the likely event that I plateau at "blundering", it's a relief to know that developer Rubeki Games has updated the game with an Explore Mode that makes certain sections dramatically easier.

 
Read more
articles.title: One of 2024's grandest and hardest first-person exploration games just got a lot easier

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I've been trying to work out if I'm keen on Soulframe only because I feel guilty about missing the boat with Warframe. I reviewed Digital Extremes' hit free-to-play shooter in 2013, back when people were still calling it a spiritual successor to the developer's boomerang-throwing action game Dark Sector. I didn't like Warframe much at the time. Think I gave it a 6/10. Warp forward a decade, and that 6/10 game has become a thriving live service phenomenon - fifteenth on the Steam Most Played charts at the time of writing, and profitable enough to spawn its own annual TennoCon expo. It's also become an intoxicating, confusing morass of dynastic sci-fantasy politicking and genre-shifting expansions, ranging from capital ship mechanics to questions of time travel, wrapped in layers of cosmetics that make Destiny look about as colourful as Gears Of War. 


I definitely didn't see all that coming. I doubt Digital Extremes saw it coming either. Warframe today feels like a lab experiment run amok. I love its appetite for novelty, but there's a lot for a returning player to catch up on and, frankly, it feels like homework. As such, I had a couple of broad motivations for playing Soulframe's pre-alpha "prelude": I'm keen to see what Digital Extremes can do when they aren't encumbered by 10 years of world-building, and I want to get in on the ground floor before they absolutely swamp this thing in updates.
 
Read more
articles.title: Soulframe has the bones of a great action-RPG, but I’m enjoying it partly because it feels too late to enjoy Warframe

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Train, one of Counter-Strike's oldest and bestest maps, has received a sweeping update. Valve's given the fairly nondescript trainyard a "full visual overhaul" in Counter-Strike 2, making it "60% cloudier" and changing its layout to encourage more tactical play besides just whipping out the AWP and looking down long, narrow corridors.
Read more
articles.title: Classic Counter-Strike map Train returns in CS2 with a total overhaul, making it "60% cloudier"

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
A senator for the US government has urged Valve to answer complaints about the amount of racist, sexist and otherwise hateful posts and imagery shared by users on Steam. The digital store was the subject of a report by the Anti-Defamation League last week, which claimed to find millions of examples of "hateful or extremist" language and images hosted on Steam's community. These include things like Nazi symbols in profile pictures, white supremacist slogans in group names, and yet more discriminatory spew in user posts. The senator has noticed this report, and now writes directly to Gabe Newell, demanding that Valve "bring its content moderation practices in line with industry standards" or risk "intense scrutiny" from the government.
Read more
articles.title: Valve must address swastikas and other hate on Steam, writes US senator in a letter to Gabe Newell

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Joining the rare but always brilliant category of “games that sound like someone scratched the high concept into their arm at pub closing time with the sharp corner of a Frazzles packet” is Assassinvisible - a stealth game about an invisible assassin that’s so invisible the player doesn’t know where they are. True, games like Invisigun have experimented with this interesting concept before, but in Assassinvisible it's framed by another - the whole game exists as doodles in a bored student’s notebook. Here’s the Tres-tray:
Read more
articles.title: Play as an assassin so stealthy you can’t see yourself in Assassinvisible

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
As per a recent update to their FAQ page, The Game Awards have confirmed that DLCs, new game seasons for live service games, and other such releases are eligible for their game of the year award.
The FAQ itself - which appears to have been accessible over the weekend but now links to a ‘coming soon’ page - says the following. Thanks Neowin for quoting it in its entirety:
Read more
articles.title: This year's Game Awards will accept DLC, new game seasons, expansions, and presumably Kojima’s MS Paint doodles

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Happy this week, you people! The sky is a washed eggshell blue, the air smells of circus straw, and all the fallen leaves have eyes that glitter mischievously and mouths that screech underfoot like dial-up modems. The Maw must be feeling festive. Let's see if there are any new PC games we can feed it.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! This week, it’s Game Maker’s Toolkit and Mind Over Magnet mechanics knower, explainer, and designer, Mark Brown! Cheers Mark! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
 Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: Game Maker's Toolkit and Mind Over Magnet's Mark Brown

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I will spend this Sunday nursing a chest infection, probably by wrapping blankets around myself and watching YouTube videos until sleep comes. Let's first round up some good links with writing and videos about videogames.

This is surely the best link this week: an hour-long video on how to beat "every possible game of Pokemon Platinum at the same time". That is, coming up with a set of game inputs that can win billions of possible permutations of the game, as determined by its RNG, when played simultaneously. It's an impressive feat, but the video itself is great too, patiently breaking down the process with motion graphics and video editing flair. Delightful.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Half-Life 2 just turned 20-years-old, and to celebrate Valve updated the game with some new features. They also produced a documetary in which several of its development team look back on their work on the game and its episodic expansions - including the never-released Episode 3.

The documentary includes in-progress footage of the episode in action for the first time, and it shows an ice gun and a new liquid enemy type.

 
Read more
articles.title: Half-Life 2: Episode 3 could have featured an ice gun and blob monsters, as seen in new documentary footage

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Half-Life 2 just turned 20 years old, and to celebrate Valve have released an update for their classic first-person shooter. In brief: they've recorded developer commentary; they've added Steam Workshop support; Episodes One and Two are now part of the package; and there are some bug fixes and new graphics options.

Grab it before the end of the weekend (November 18th at 6pm GMT) and it's also free to keep on Steam.

 
Read more
articles.title: Half-Life 2 is 20 years old and has been updated with Steam Workshop support and developer commentary

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
It's a strange new world we find ourselves in. Previously, we'd only feared for those of you playing games with names like "The Addresses Of All Notable Public Figures in Terra Gaia VI" and "Xtreme Bomb Maker: Easily Obtainable Household Objects Edition". Alas, the automod decided that what a healthy comment system really needs is a blanket ban on the entirety of language. Typical robot. Anyway, that should be sorted now, so please welcome this most hallowed of RPS traditions back with aplomb. No. Aplomb. Christ. It's coming for us now. Here's what we're clicking on:
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Šéfka projektu elementary OS, Danielle Foré, informuje o vydání již osmé verze této linuxové distribuce snažící se co nejvíce přiblížit uživatelskému zážitku z Apple macOS. Novinek není zrovna málo.
articles.title: Distribuce elementary OS 8 aneb macOS v linuxovém kabátku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: Komprese dat má za cíl zmenšit objem nebo datový tok dat. Bez komprese by např. běžná digitální fotografie měla desítky megabajtů. Je tedy velmi žádoucí taková multimediální data komprimovat.
articles.title: Algoritmy pro kompresi dat: entropická kódování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dnešním článku dokončíme popis vlastností tenzorů. Ukážeme si, jaké operace je možné s tenzory provádět, ať již se jedná o operace prováděné prvek po prvku, o takzvaný broadcasting nebo o komplikovanější činnosti.
articles.title: Manipulace s tenzory v knihovně PyTorch (dokončení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Eischmann)
articles.description: Když Apple uvedl vlastní čipsety pro své počítače, linuxová komunita rozjela projekt Asahi Linux a začala pracovat na tom, aby na tomto hardwaru běžel i Linux. Jak se Asahi instaluje a je použitelný?
articles.title: Asahi Linux na počítači od Apple: instalace a zkušenosti z provozu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Pravidelná středeční sonda do světa software. Dnes se společně podíváme na unifikovaný nástroj pro práci s repozitáři v GitHub a GitLab, budeme hromadně posílat HTTP požadavky a nakonec si představíme nový webový prohlížeč.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (27. 11. 2024): testujte automaticky HTTP(S) servery

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Bařina)
articles.description: GMP (GNU MP nebo též libgmp) je otevřená knihovna pro práci s čísly v libovolně přesné aritmetice. Ve druhém článku se podíváme na umocňování, výpočet modulu nebo různé funkce z teorie čísel.
articles.title: Knihovna GMP: umocňování, výpočet modulu a funkce z teorie čísel

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Budeme se zabývat velmi často řešenou úlohou: analýzou, zda je předložený text spam nebo se jedná o jiný typ textu (ham). Při vektorizaci textu využijeme takzvané n-gramy.
articles.title: Využití knihovny scikit-learn pro zpracování a analýzu přirozeného jazyka (NLP), 3.část

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Monika Kutějová)
articles.description: V tomto pravidelném vydání pondělních Postřehů z bezpečnosti se podíváme na využití AI severokorejskými útočníky, pročínskou vlivovou síť podvodných webů nebo nové malwary z arzenálu ruských skupin.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: Rusko, Čína i KLDR opět na scéně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt quBSD je nadstavba FreeBSD jails, který implementuje schéma inspirované Qubes. Po 22 letech vývoje byla vydána verze FreeCAD 1.0. Tuxedo mění licenci pro moduly linuxového jádra z GPL-3.0+ na GPL-2.0+.
articles.title: Projekt quBSD se inspiroval Qubes, FreeCAD 1.0 vyšel po 22 letech

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Týden v KDE: počet cyklů nabití konečně v Plasmě, DAW Zrythm v nové verzi 1.0 stále s GTK, jádro Linux 6.13 bez novinek v Bcachefs, vývojová verze Wine 9.22 jako poslední před Wine 10.0-rc1.
articles.title: Optimalizace pro Ryzeny s 3D V-Cache i podpora běhu Radeonů na LoongArch míří do jádra

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Git je moderní distribuovaný verzovací systém, který umožňuje efektivní správu kódu. Umožňuje spolupráci na projektech, automatizaci pracovních postupů pomocí CI/CD a sledování změn. Naučte se, jak používat Git efektivně na našem školení verzovacího systému Git.
articles.title: Git pro každého: naučte se spravovat kód efektivně na našem školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mezi různými nápravnými opatřeními, která navrhlo Ministerstvo spravedlnosti Spojených států amerických k řešení zneužívání monopolního postavení společnosti Google, je také zákaz platit za to, aby se Google stal výchozím vyhledávačem v jiných zařízeních, platformách nebo aplikacích.
articles.title: Mozilla prosí soudy, aby povolily Googlu platit za výchozí vyhledávač ve Firefoxu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost ESET objevila první bootkit pro UEFI (Unified Extensible Firmware Interface) určený speciálně pro linuxové systémy s názvem Bootkitty. Umožňuje útočníkům vypnout funkci ověřování podpisu jádra a při bootu pak zavést dva binární soubory ELF prostřednictvím init systému. Jejich prostřednictvím je pak možné do jádra přidat vlastní modul a tím zcela ovládnout systém.
articles.title: Bootkitty je první UEFI bootkit určený pro Linux

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Byl uvolněn elementary OS 8, postavený na základu Ubuntu 24.04 LTS a poháněný linuxovým jádrem 6.8. Přináší řadu vylepšení jak v desktopovém prostředí Pantheon, tak ve svých základních aplikacích a elegantním uživatelském prostředí.
articles.title: Vyšel elementary OS 8 s novým dokem, rychlým nastavením a bezpečnou relací

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Phoronix v několika testech porovnal výpočetní (nikoli herní) výkon integrovaného grafického jádra Xe2 v nejnovějších mobilních procesorech Intel Lunar Lake s předchozí generací Xe v Meteor Lake. V řadě testů jde o nárůst o velké desítky procent, byť jistě i díky vyššímu nastavení spotřeby notebooku.
articles.title: Oproti Meteor Lake je iGPU v Lunar Lake ve výpočtech o polovinu rychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Amazonu na chvíli unikly dva modely od ASRocku, a tak můžeme říci, že druhá generace „velkých“ grafických karet Intel je těsně před uvedením. Prvním modelem na trhu bude Arc B580, který by číselně naznačoval zhruba střední segment, nicméně s ohledem na absenci zmínek o „sedmistovkové“ řadě a dřívějších neoficiálních informací, podle kterých Intel nejvyšší verzi zrušil, lze předpokládat, že B580 je aktuálním stropem.
articles.title: Intel Arc B580, Xe2 generaci grafických karet Intel Battlemage prozradil Amazon a ASRock

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 9. a 10. prosince. Školení proběhne pouze online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Dnes bylo oznámeno vydání Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5, což je modulární verze jednodeskového počítače Raspberry Pi 5, který je na trhu přibližně rok. Cena nové desky je 45 dolarů a stejně jako její starší sourozenci umožňuje zabudování do rozsáhlejších embedded řešení.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Compute Module 5 je nyní v prodeji za 45 dolarů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: GIMP 1.0 vyšel 1998, GIMP 2.0 vyšel 2004, GIMP 2.10 vyšel 2018 a od té doby už má tahle řada celkem 18 vydání, ale díky prvnímu kandidátovi na GIMP 3.0, novou hlavní verzi, se snad tato mizérie chýlí ke konci a i Ubuntu jej vyhlíží a pro nejbližší jarní vydání už počítá s GIMPem 3.0.x.
articles.title: Ubuntu 25.04 nabídne příští rok GIMP 3.0

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Richard Hughes z Red Hatu oznámil vydání nové verze balíku Fwupd 2.0.2 pro aktualizace firmwarů na Linuxu. Přináší podporu kontroly nastavení AMD MSR, emulace enumerate-only a podporu přeposílání JSON namísto ZIP v rámci podpory emulace, naopak mizí podpora zastaralých zařízení CSR DFU / Nitrokey. Opraveno je též několik chyb.
articles.title: Fwupd 2.0.2 s komunitní podporou Asus ROG ALLY a ROG ALLY X

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Hlavní novinkou „stotřiatřicáté“ verze Firefoxu je další nový typ ochrany proti sledování uživatele, Bounce Tracking Protection, dostupný v rámci "„přísného“ nastavení Rozšířené ochrana proti sledování. Věc detailněji popisuje John Willander na GitHubu. Dále vývojáři implementovali otevírání panelů z jiných zařízení prostřednictvím nabídky s přehledem panelů. Na Windows je k dispozici GPU akcelerace pro Canvas2D.
articles.title: Firefox 133 přidává Bounce Tracking Protection, Firefox 128.5.0 ESR opravuje chyby

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nový AI pomocník Recall pro Windows 11 má zaznamenávat vše, co uživatel na počítači dělá. Má dělat snímky obrazovky a pomocí AI zaznamenávat v textové podobě co se říká na videokonferencích nebo ve videích, která uživatel sleduje. Ze snímků obrazovek bude také strojově přepisován text (OCR). Uživatelé se však obávají o svoje soukromí a proto byl Recall již několikrát odložen.
articles.title: Kontroverzní Recall ve Windows 11 nakonec vyšel, ale jen pro Qualcomm Snapdragon

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Docker je dnes technologie, která proces vývoje, testování a provozování softwaru velmi zjednodušuje. Provozujte cokoliv a kdekoliv. Už nečekejte na nastavení svého serveru nebo na aktualizaci nějaké knihovny. Mějte prostředí jako součást vaší aplikace.
articles.title: Naučte se pracovat s Dockerem a kontejnery (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Dnes se začalo prodávat Raspberry Pi Pico 2 W, jde v podstatě o Raspberry Pi Pico 2 s přidanými bezdrátovými připojeními 2,4 GHz Wi-Fi 802.11n a BT 5.2.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Pico 2 W s 2,4 GHz Wi-Fi a BT 5.2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Zaseklá úloha (hung task) je taková úloha, která se nachází dlouhou dobu ve stavu D (Uninterruptible sleep – usually IO).  Čas varování lze nastavit pomocí hung_task_timeout_secs a výchozí je 120 sekund. Navíc je možné nastavit hung_task_panic=1 a to spolu s nastavením například panic=60 restartuje počítač po 60 sekundách po detekování zaseklé úlohy.
articles.title: Jádro 6.13 bude hlásit počet zaseklých úloh

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Japonský NCAC (National Consumer Affairs Center) doporučuje lidem, aby plánovali, co se stane po jejich digitální smrti. Doporučeno je:
articles.title: V Japonsku doporučují dát uživatelská jména a hesla do závěti

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Včera vyšla verze 8.4.1 programovacího jazyka PHP. Mezi novinky patří háčky vlastností (property hooks), nesymetrická viditelnost (asymmetric visibility), líné objekty (lazy objects) a #[\Deprecated].
articles.title: Nové PHP 8.4.1: háčky vlastností, nesymetrická viditelnost a líné objekty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Loki je nástroj na sběr, ukládaní a prohlížení logu. Je to nástroj od Grafany, takže je s ní přímo integrovaná. Připravili jsme pro vás nové školení Loki – Log management v Grafaně, na kterém se naučíte nasadit Loki Stack (Loki, Grafana a Promtail) a budete do něj schopni ukládat logy. Dále se naučíte, jak logy prohledávat, ukážeme si, jak nastavit retenci logu i jak nad daty z logu dělat dashboardy a alerting.
articles.title: Loki: log management v Grafaně (školeni)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Do jádra 6.13 se ve středu dostala podpora pro SDUC (Secure Digital Ultra Capacity) karty s kapacitou 2–128 TB. Formát SDUC byl poprvé oznámen v roce 2018, rozšiřuje formát SDXC pro kapacity nad 2 TB.
articles.title: Jádro 6.13 přidává podporu pro SD karty 2–128 TB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dnes je tomu 29 let od chvíle, kdy tehdejší student na Berkeley, Peter Mattis, oznámil projekt GIMP, tehdy ještě General Image Manipulation Program, nyní GNU Image Manipulation Program, ale stále GIMP.
articles.title: GIMP oslavil 29 let

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V balíčku Needrestart, který je ve výchozím nastavení nainstalován například v Ubuntu Serveru od verze 21.04, bylo odhaleno několik velmi starých bezpečnostních chyb, které lokálnímu útočníkovi umožňují získat práva roota bez nutnosti interakce s uživatelem.
articles.title: Bezpečnostní chyba v balíčku Needrestart umožňuje ovládnout systém

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Spolu s dále rozvinutou obecnou podporu běhu Linuxu na Raspberry Pi 5, která se objevila v jádru 6.12, přinese následné jádro 6.13 též podporu Raspberry Pi Camera Front-End (CFE) pomocí příslušného ovladče. Za jeho vývojem stojí přímo Raspberry Pi a Ideas on Board. Ovladač se postará jak o samotnou podporu hardwarového bloku CFE a zpracování signálu, tak MIPI D-PHY a MIPI CSI-2.
articles.title: Jádro Linux 6.13 přinese podporu Raspberry Pi Camera Front End

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Superpočítač El Capitan je novým králem světového žebříčku. Tento stroj s více než 11 milióny CPU jader v podobě procesorů EPYC generace Zen 4 v kombinaci s „GPU“ AMD Instinct MI300A dosahuje při spotřebě 29,58 MW výkonu 1,742, resp. 2,746 EFLOPS (Rmax, resp. Rpeak). Dodala jej společnost HPE, operačním systémem je TOSS (Tri-Lab Operating System Stack stavějící na RHELu).
articles.title: Žebříček TOP 500: El Capitan s CPU+GPU AMD vede, Intel až na třetím místě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: Dňa 12. novembra bola vydaná vývojová platforma .NET vo verzii 9 v rámci ktorej jazyk C# prešiel na verziu 13 a dočkal sa niekoľkých menších noviniek .
articles.title: Novinky v C# 13

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Po 13 letech od předchozí verze 1.3 vydali tvůrci novou verzi frameworku FLTK 1.4, alias Fast Light Toolkit, známý například z rozhraní projektu CinePaint. V éře všemožných Wayland kompozitorů jde sice o velmi neobvyklou událost, avšak ukazující silnou stránku open-source: i řešení, která se léty stala v podstatě obskurními, mohou nadále žít a adaptovat se na nový svět, zde tedy primárně ten Waylandový.
articles.title: FLTK 1.4 s podporou Waylandu a HiDPI

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nová generace all-flash úložišť OceanStor Dorado pro éru AI. HPE představuje jednotnou správu virtualizace, nové rychlé objektové úložiště a izolované privátní cloudy. Dell Technologies urychluje AI inovace a posiluje kybernetickou bezpečnost. Vedení pod mořem jsou důležitá infrastruktura, Západ se bojí jejího narušení. Vědci zkoumali, jak umělá inteligence dokáže v textu rozpoznávat lidské emoce. Huawei: Společně pro ekologičtější a inteligentnější budoucnost v Evropě. Nový Red Hat OpenShift AI zvyšuje škálovatelnost a přizpůsobivost umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Vedení pod mořem jsou důležitá infrastruktura, Západ se bojí jejího narušení

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Podivná neutronová hvězda vyvolává nejistotu. Dvě vrstvy atomů dostali do blízkosti 50 nanometrů. Práškový diamant by mohl v magnetické rezonanci nahradit gadolinium. Syntéza kvalitního grafenu vyžaduje prostředí bez stop kyslíku.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Vědci dokázali vyladit Casimirovu sílu pomocí magnetického pole

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Pomocí DNA vyrobili diamantové fotonické krystaly. Obětí phishing útoků se v posledním roce stalo až 80 % organizací kritické infrastruktury. AWS Cloud Day Prague 2024. Synology Experience Day 2024. Pure Storage zjednodušuje migraci podnikových prostředí VMware do cloudu Microsoft Azure. Chris Keller z AWS přiblížil na Cloud Day Prague novinky.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Obětí phishing útoků se v posledním roce stalo až 80 % organizací kritické infrastruktury

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Chemie ultratěžkých prvků moscovia (115) a nihonia (113) má souviset s relativistickými efekty. Navrhují vznik temné energie v černých dírách. Kvantové provázání přežije i chemickou reakci. Ničení nebezpečných objektů jejich stáhnutím do atmosféry. Temná hmota by mohla hvězdám zajistit nesmrtelnost.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Magický grafen může být supravodivý jen do 60 K

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Máme zde výprodej na Black Friday a ceny od Dckeyoffer jsou opravdu skvělé když sháníte originální doživotní licence na Windows. Během výprodeje na Black Friday máme vysoké slevy na platné licence na Windows a Office. Zejména klíč na Windows 11 je dnes nejžádanější, tak na co čekat?
articles.title: Při výprodeji Black Friday je doživotní licence Windows 11 jen za €20, za Office €24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled říjnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Umělá inteligence zvyšuje náklady na datová centra, hlavně kvůli spotřebě elektřiny. Hospodářská komora: Zákon o kybernetické bezpečnosti výrazně zvýší náklady pro firmy. Global Mobile Broadband Forum 2024: 5.5G a AI jako základ nové éry mobilní komunikace. Digitální podnikové služby v Česku nabírají na síle: 175 tisíc zaměstnanců, robotizace a nové investice táhnou růst. Dell Technologies rozšiřuje portfolio Dell AI Factory o nové servery PowerEdge. Agentforce od Salesforce: důvěryhodní, autonomní agenti s umělou inteligencí posilují pracovní síly ve firmách.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Umělá inteligence zvyšuje náklady na datová centra, hlavně kvůli spotřebě elektřiny

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Matematiku a přírodní vědu prý spojuje stejná role náhodných procesů a pravděpodobnosti. Opice, Shakespeare a Rossův–Littlewoodův paradox. Vědci odhalili původ meteoritů dopadajících na Zemi.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Že by za Fermiho paradox mohla umělá inteligence?

articles.description: Distribuce Tails specializující se ochranu online soukromí uživatele byla vydána ve verzi 6.10. Mimo jiné aktualizuje Tor Browser (14.0.3) a Thunderbird (128.4.3), opravuje několik chyb.

articles.title: exFAT Driver With Linux 6.13 Reduces FAT Chain Traversal For Better Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in April AMD announced the Versal Gen 2 Adaptive SoCs for AI-driven embedded systems. In preparing for Versal2 evaluation kits expected around the middle of the year and production silicon by the end of 2025, AMD software engineers have begun ramping up their open-source and upstream-focused Linux driver support...
articles.title: AMD Begins Work Upstreaming More Versal 2 SoC Support For Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The RISC-V CPU port updates have been sent out for the in-development Linux 6.13 kernel...
articles.title: RISC-V Changes For Linux 6.13 Deliver Pointer Masking In User-Space

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those building your own server around the new Intel Xeon 6 "Granite Rapids" or AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" platforms and using DDR5-6000/DDR5-6400 memory (or the interesting MRDIMM-8000 memory with Xeon 6 P), one of the factors you need to be much more mindful about than in the past is that at least the initial generation of DDR5-6000+ memory is running much hotter than prior server memory. There's been guidance from Intel and AMD as well as sever vendors about the thermal considerations with DDR5-6000/DDR5-6400 and extra precautions. Here's a look at the DDR5-6000 thermals on a recent AMD EPYC 9655 Turin server build and then taming the DDR5 server memory modules using Corsair Vengeance Airflow Memory Cooling Fans.
articles.title: Corsair Vengeance Airflow Memory Cooling For DDR5 Server RAM

articles.description: The SoundWire subsystem updates were sent out today for the Linux 6.13 kernel. This cycle brings new AMD driver support as well as supporting the MIPI DisCo 2.0 specification...
articles.title: Linux 6.13 SoundWire Preps DisCo 2.0 Support

articles.description: Sent out on Tuesday was the modules pull request for Linux 6.13 that have some low-level improvements but it noted that the biggest kernel modules highlight wasn't in that pull request itself but had been added by way of the memory management pull. This was a change by a Microsoft engineer around caching of kernel modules into huge pages...
articles.title: Microsoft Makes An Interesting Improvement To Kernel Modules With Linux 6.13

articles.title: LoongArch Wires Up Real-Time Kernel Support & Lazy Preemption

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the end of year holidays are fast approaching, my commitment to Linux hardware and open-source software remains and there still is a lot of interesting content to come this year still -- each and every day, without change for roughly a decade. Unfortunately though due to the (sad) state of the ad industry, many major companies focusing on the likes of Facebook/Meta ads, and the frequent use of ad-blockers by Linux/FLOSS readers make ongoing operations increasingly difficult. But if you'd like to show some love this holiday season, the Phoronix Premium "Cyber Week" / "Black Friday" special is now taking place so you can enjoy the site ad-free, native dark mode support, multi-page articles on a single page, and other benefits while hopefully allowing the site to continue for years to come...
articles.title: Phoronix Premium Cyber Week Sale To Better Enjoy Our Linux Hardware Reviews & News

articles.description: Now that Linux 6.12 has a fix for the Lunar Lake performance with the ASUS Zenbook I have been using for my Core Ultra 200V series Linux testing as well as there recently being an updated Intel Compute Runtime with Lunar Lake fixes, I have been working on some fresh Lunar Lake Xe2 graphics benchmarks using the very latest upstream open-source code. In today's article is exploring how the Xe2 Lunar Lake graphics is performing for OpenCL / GPU compute relative to the prior Meteor Lake Arc Graphics that were already a nice step-up over earlier Intel integrated graphics.
articles.title: Intel Xe2 Lunar Lake Graphics Compute / OpenCL Performance Looking Great

articles.author: Chris Penwell
articles.description:
The Pumpkin Soup Disney Dreamlight Valley recipe is a magnificent appetizer for your pals like Mickey or Remy. It counts as a four-star dish, which will help you finish some Dreamlight tasks. 


Pumpkin Soup Disney Dreamlight Valley ingredients


To create Pumpkin Soup, you'll need to find the following ingredients, and thankfully, you won't need any of the DLC like The Storybook Vale: 



Pumpkin


Ginger


Any vegetable


Milk




Screenshot by Destructoid


Screenshot by Destructoid


Screenshot by Destructoid



Pumpkin Seeds or, if you're lucky, the squash vegetable itself can be bought from Goofy's Stall in the Forgotten Lands. The seeds are 275 Star Coins, while the vegetable is 996 Star Coins. By the way, if you plant many Pumpkins, they are a great way of making money as there's a lot of profit in selling these to Goofy. 


Ginger can also be found in the Forgotten Lands. This time, it doesn't require your wallet. Look to the ground, and you'll find the ingredient planted in the ground. Look for a long green stalk poking out of the ground. Pick up the crop.


Milk can be bought at Chez Remy for 230 Star Coins. You'll need to finish the quests from the Ratatouille realm to unlock the restaurant. You can find the realm in the castle. For the vegetable, you can use another Pumpkin or grow a crop that grows quickly like a Carrot from Goofy's Stall in the Peaceful Meadow. 


Once you have all four ingredients, go to a cooking station like your house or Chez Remy. Throw all of them into the pot, and you'll have a lovely Pumpkin Soup in your possession. You can sell it for around 1,461 Star Coins (depending on the vegetable you choose) and eat the dish for 1,591 Energy. If you have the Storybook Vale DLC, you can also make Stuffed Ring Squash.

The post How to make Pumpkin Soup in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to make Pumpkin Soup in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Chris Penwell
articles.description:
The Blue Star Lily in Disney Dreamlight Valley is a pretty flower you can pick up in one of the original locations of the game. It can help you make several blue-themed items like the Blue Retro Portable Radio and others. 


Blue Star Lily Disney Dreamlight Valley Location


You can find a Blue Star Lily from the original valley within the Forest of Valor. Thankfully, you won't need any of the DLC like The Storybook Vale. 


Screenshots by Destructoid


Run around the Forest of Valor (you can also find Emeralds here) and look for a blue flower growing from the grass. You don't want the bell-shaped flowers; the Blue Star Lilies have normal petals. 


You'll be able to find around three or four of the flowers at one time. One respawns every 30 minutes, so it will take some time to craft the items you need, unfortunately. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


What can you craft with this flower?


One cute item you can make with the Blue Star Lily is a Blue Retro Portable Radio. You'll get the instructions on how to create it after picking up a Blue Star Lily. Collect the following materials and then head to a crafting table at your home or at Scrooge's shop. 



1 Blue Lily


5 Softwood


1 Iron Ingot



You can also craft Iron Ingot by collecting five Iron Ores and one Coal Ore, which you can get from mining nearby rocks. Once you have the Blue Retro Portable Radio made, you can place it as furniture inside your home. It will put on some familiar music if you interact with it.

The post Where to find Blue Star Lily in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Where to find Blue Star Lily in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Well, I can't believe that I'm saying this, but Destiny: Rising is actually pretty fun. It's not perfect by any means, but it's remarkable how much it feels like I'm playing Destiny on my phone. Now, I gravitate toward Destiny: Rising during idle time and sneaking 10-15 minutes during breaks. It's not in any position to take me away from Destiny 2 proper, but it provides a quick Destiny fix and plays well enough that I'm willing to overlook some of the more annoying aspects of mobile games.


Destiny: Rising presents a respectable slice of Destiny 2's spirit on mobile, even making a few surprising improvements in some areas. That said, there's no getting around the fact that this is a true mobile-made experience, complete with predatory microtransactions and most of the other warts that ha…

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
Palworld, or, like many call it, Pokémon with guns — or even Pokémon but cruel — is getting a massive new update. Pocketpair is teasing a new area six times larger than Sakurajima that will come packed to the brim with exciting new stuff.


The studio says the new update will also feature new Pals, trainers to fight against, new bosses, and will serve as a new high-difficulty challenge for fans of the original experience. The update will roll out sometime in December, with more details pending soon.


Palworld has recently also announced a huge Terraria crossover, which we also don't know much about. Pocketpair merely released a photo of a character from Palworld shaking hands with Terraria's main guy. Will we see Palworld make the jump to 2d? Will we get to dig and build incredibly intricate torture, I mean, productivity devices in Palworld? Pocketpair promises more details will emerge soon on that one as well. 




Though we're yet to see any concrete details regarding either big update, the announcements at least prove the surprise mega-hit is far from dead. And it really needs to show its teeth, as Pocketpair is still preparing for a tough copyright battle with Nintendo over the similarities between Palworld and I'll let you guess what.


Nintendo is accusing Pocketpair of, among other patent infringements, stealing the concept of throwing a ball to capture wild creatures. Palworld sure does feature that, but Pocketpair has already stated that the studio will fight the lawsuit.


You can currently get Palworld for 25% off as part of Steam's Autumn sale, so this might be a great time to check it out and pick your side in the big copyright war of our times.

The post Palworld announces huge update and a Terraria crossover appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Palworld announces huge update and a Terraria crossover

After ruling the home console roost for almost a decade, the mid-nineties were a turning point for Nintendo, and not in a “they finally quit cocaine and got their act together” kind of way. After creating their own worst enemy by screwing Sony in an effort to make a CD expansion for the Super Nintendo, they were struggling with getting their own next-generation console to the market. A lot of other companies were touting their fancy 32-bit monstrosities, and Nintendo needed something to convince people that they were still on the cutting edge. Otherwise, they might turn to Phillips, Atari, or 3DO to satiate their need for extra bits.

articles.author: Zeeshan Khan
articles.description:
Surge is a legendary brawler in Brawl Stars who was first available through the Brawl Pass in Season 2: Summer of Monsters. His main attack is to shoot a juice projectile that splits when it hits enemies. 


What’s even better is that his Super lets him leap over walls, deal damage, knock back enemies, and upgrade his attacks and movement. With his Hypercharge, he even gets a fourth-stage upgrade that makes his shots stronger and split more often.


However, like any other brawler, he also needs some enhancement in the form of a gadget, a star power, and gears. To help you with that, here is a comprehensive guide on the best build of Surge in Brawl Stars.


Best build for Surge in Brawl Stars


Screenshot by Destructoid



Gadget: Power Surge


Star Power: To the Max!


Gear 1: Speed


Gear 2: Damage



Starting with the gadget, you can use the “Power Surge” as it increases the Surge’s Stage by one for ten seconds. However, there is a downside: Surge cannot use this gadget if he is at stage three. 


In terms of star power, you should try on “To the Max!” as his main attack will now be split into two halves if it crosses any obstacles like walls. What’s even better is that it will split into six halves if you are in stage three.


You can use speed and damage gear, which will make Surge an absolute beast. Once you equip the speed gear, Surge will move 15% faster in bushes, as he is an easy target for any throwers in Brawl Stars. 


With the damage gear, Surge will deal 15% more when his hit points are less than half. However, you can only inflict extra damage on the enemy brawlers, not any spawnable objects like Nita’s bear. So it is advised not to use this gear around them and wait for the right time to unleash your attacks.

The post Best Surge build in Brawl Stars appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Best Surge build in Brawl Stars

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
CP is one of the easiest resources to earn in UFL, but it's also the most important item you'll need to improve your squad in the latest football game.


Unlike other titles like eFootball 2025 and EA FC 25, UFL doesn't have a gacha for unlocking footballers. There's no trading or auction market, and you have to buy cards directly. For that, you'll need RP and CP. Let's take a look at how you can get more in-game currency.


How to get more CP in UFL


The easiest way to get CP is by playing in the Ranked Mode. Every game you complete will help you earn CP, and the rate will double if you've activated Premium. The return will increase further if you're using a CP boost. At the time of writing, no other game mode will help you get this resource.


Another great way to get CP is by selling cards that you won't need. Your squad will have limited slots, and you can't have an unlimited number of cards. Instead of expanding the total slots, it's better to release the cards that you no longer need. This will also help you get RP, which is needed to sign new players.


Image via Destructoid


The Star Pass is currently available at the launch of early access. It's very easy to activate the Premium track, which has better rewards. Some of these rewards will grant you CP boosters, which will fetch you more resources whenever you're completing a match in a competitive mode.


Completing daily objectives is key. As of writing, weekly objectives aren't available, but completing the daily tasks will help you get SP, LP, and CP. All three items are vital if you want to quickly improve your squad.


UFL might be a free game, but you can spend real-life money to buy CP directly from the shop. You can't buy RP directly, so spend accordingly and try to even out your expenses to build your squad in a balanced fashion.

The post How to earn CP in UFL appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to earn CP in UFL
